entries.name: Coordinating Gear
entries: Some adventurers view their weapons, themselves, and even their teammates as parts of a well-oiled machine, its cogs grinding up enemies in combat!

entries.name: Clockwork Arms
entries: These contraptions combine magic with clockwork mechanization to strike the down the enemies of progress, or whomever happens to be standing in the wielder's way.

entries.name: Paired Weapons
entries: Fearsome on their own, these weapons are even more powerful when used in combat alongside their intended counterpart.

entries.name: Celestial Armory
entries: Weapons found within this vault are inspired by Golarion's moon and stars, as well as the deities who claim dominion over them.

entries.name: Beast Armaments
entries: Beast armaments are weapons crafted from the body parts of specific types of monsters and are imbued with some of the monster's own essence or special abilities.
See {@variantrule Nature Crafting|TV} for rules that can give you interesting ways to incorporate beast armaments into your game.

entries.name: Spark Guns and Star Guns

reference.note: {@note Read the full lore entry from page 38 of the {@link Treasure Vault|https://paizo.com/products/btq02eav}.}

entries: Crafting a spark gun is a complicated magical process, knowledge of which remains relatively regional. As a result, spark guns are {@trait uncommon} in the majority of Arcadia, though they're {@trait common} in the Arcane Empires and Deadshot Lands regions. Spark guns are {@trait rare} outside of Arcadia.

entries.name: Weapons of Peace?
entries: When I was arranging the boss's runed weapons the other day, one of the racks fell on top of me and I thought for sure I was dead!
